title: Does Chegg pay for those answers which are unrated? - Quora

response.answer_text: Chegg basically requires it's subject matter experts to provide quality content. Though American students are allowed to rate each answer, they might not always opt for it. But that doesn't affect subject payout rates. You must pay attention to the quality of answers and strictly adhere to the guidelines laid down by Chegg. As long as you do this, your earnings won't be affected at all, i.e. you will be paid for every question you answer.

Yes, I am working in Chegg from one and a half year. Chegg paid you for every legitimate answer i.e, correct according to their guidelines. It doesn’t matter at all that your answer is rated or not. So please don’t worry about that if you attempt the questions according to chegg guidelines. Even sometimes, Students give negative rating for even a correct question, but Chegg Expert team looks into that and paid you for every legitimate answer.

Offcourse Yes.. Chegg will pay each and every answers which you have submitted provided the solutions are correct. If the solutions are not well organised, you may get a warning email for improving solutions (otherwise your account will revocated), but you will get earning for each and every question.

No. Chegg only pays for solutions that are reviewed three or above, which is an accumulated rating from the students and administrators. The site is all about supporting quality, and quality only. Those who are good in both solving problems and explaining them, won’t have a problem and will get their pay.. in a timely manner I might add.
Yes, Chegg pay for all questions which you uploaded at Chegg profile while Rated or not rated or wrong answer submitted.
